abstract: Commerce Department reports consumer spending rose 0.3 percent in July, after comparable rise in June.
lead_paragraph: The Department of Commerce said on Friday that consumer spending, buoyed by vehicle sales, increased 0.3 percent in July.

headline.main: Solid Consumer Spending Expected to Help U.S. Push Past Market Sell-Off
headline.print_headline: Consumers Spent More Freely in July

snippet: The Department of Commerce said on Friday that consumer spending, buoyed by vehicle sales, increased 0.3 percent in July.
